title: Marvel Zombies X review: Netizens want another season of the bloody, gory animated series, call it a 'bland ending'
text:
Marvel Zombies X review: Bryan Andrews launched Marvel Zombies on September 24, with all four episodes dropping on the same day. The action-horror series is set in a zombie apocalypse.
Last Updated: 02.58 PM, Sep 25, 2025
Marvel Animation’s Marvel Zombies series has dropped all four episodes on Disney Plus and JioHotstar (accessible via OTTplay Premium). While many fans have shared their initial reactions about the bloody and gory animated series, some are still planning to binge-watch it. Wondering what netizens are saying about Disney’s first TV-MA-rated animated show? Here’s a quick glance into their mixed reviews, as some find it entertaining, while others call it disappointing for the bad ending.
Bryan Andrews launched Marvel Zombies on September 24, with all four episodes dropping on the same day. Set in a zombie apocalypse, the series brings an epic fight between a gang of new superheroes and the Avengers turned undead creatures. From Red Guardian and Blade to the Scarlet Witch, the series features many popular superheroes and supervillains. Taking to X (formerly Twitter), netizens have shared a mixed review on the limited series. While many expressed disappointment on the bland and abrupt ending, others want an official confirmation for season 2. One wrote, “I need Marvel Zombies Season 2; it can’t end like that.”
Another said, “Marvel Zombies season 2 is going to be Wandavision all over again greenlight season 2 now.”
Some praised the animated effects and creative vision, while others gave it a thumbs down for loose writing and dialogues. One shared, “50% pretty cool visual stuff/fights and ideas, 50% the worst dialogue I have ever heard in my life.”
Many of the social media users have compared the Marvel comics with the animated adaptation. “Yeah, the comic Marvel Zombies sucked, this feels a little rush, but it´s at least better argumented than the original comic,” said another.
Watch out for other reactions here:
Marvel Zombies episode 1 features Riri, Kamala, and Kate trying to figure out how to reverse the zombie apocalypse as the army of zombies led by the Queen of the Dead orders them to kill the female-led superhero squad. They soon team up with Red Guardian, Yelena, Blade, and the others to save everyone from the undead creatures in a blood-curdling battle. Florence Pugh, Awkwafina, Todd Williams, David Harbour, Simu Liu, Randall Park, Hudson Thames, Hailee Steinfeld, and Dominique Thorne are all part of the voice cast.
